validate:
确认，证实，确认 有效 
to make (something) valid
reel:
绕线鱼线等 
to pull in (a fish that is caught on a hook on the end of a fishing line) by turning the reel of 
a fishing rod

卷轴用来缠绕线，金属丝和胶卷 
a device shaped like a cylinder that a string, cord, etc., is wrapped around
emulate:
效仿 
to try to be like (someone or something you admire)
stately:
威严的，富丽堂皇的 
very impressive in appearance, manner, or size 
37
terse:
简洁的，精练的 
brief and direct in a way that may seem rude or unfriendly
arbitrate:
仲裁 
to settle an argument between two people or groups after hearing the opinions and ideas of both
impair:
削弱 
to make (something) weaker or worse
self-aggrandizing:
自大的 
doing or saying things to make yourself seem more powerful or important
pretext:
托辞 
a reason that you give to hide your real reason for doing something
despotic:
专制的 
of, relating to, or characteristic of a despot
recurrence:
重现；复发 
the fact of occurring again.
inculcate:
反复灌输 
to cause (something) to be learned by (someone) by repeating it again and again
disgrace:
耻辱 
the condition of feeling ashamed or of losing or becoming unworthy of respect or approval

使 失宠；给 丢脸 
to cause (someone or something) to lose or become unworthy of respect or approval
sonorous:
雄浑的；浑厚的 
having a pleasant full deep sound
reverent:
恭敬的 
showing a lot of respect; very respectful
interject:
打断 
to interrupt what someone else is saying with (a comment, remark, etc.)
feud:
长期争吵，结怨，结仇 
to carry on a feud; quarrel

长期不和，长期争斗 
a long and angry fight or quarrel between two people or two groups
stripe:
条纹 
a long, narrow line of color 
38
invertebrate:
无脊椎的 
lacking a spinal column

无脊椎动物 
a type of animal that does not have a backbone
unwieldy:
笨拙的，不灵便的 
difficult to handle, control, or deal with because of being large, heavy, or complex
hack:
砍 
to cut (something or someone) many times and usually in a rough and violent way
besiege:
围攻，包围 
to surround a city, building, etc., with soldiers and try to take control of it
illegible:
难以辨认的，无法辨识的，字迹模糊的 
not clear enough to be read
brink:
峭壁、河岸等的边沿，边缘 
the extreme edge of land, for example at the top of a cliff or by a river
nurture:
养育；养护；培养 
to care for and protect somebody/something while they are growing and developing

养育；培养 
care, encouragement and support given to somebody/something while they are growing
enigmatic:
神秘难解的 
full of mystery and difficult to understand
sap:
植物体内运送养分的液，汁 
the liquid in a plant or tree that carries food to all its parts

使虚弱；削弱；逐渐破坏 
to make something/somebody weaker; to destroy something gradually
transitory:
短暂的，转瞬即逝的 
lasting only for a short time; temporary
analogous:
相似的；类似的 
similar in some way to another thing or situation and therefore able to be compared with it
souvenir:
纪念物；纪念品 
a thing that you buy and/or keep to remind yourself of a place, an occasion, or a holiday/vacation; something that you bring back for other people when you have been on holiday/vacation 
39
hallmark:
标志，特征 
a quality, ability, etc., that is typical of a particular person or thing
annihilation:
歼灭，消灭，毁灭 
complete destruction or obliteration; ruin; extinction; extermination
outskirts:
郊区，郊外 
the parts of a city or town that are far from the center
paucity:
短缺 
a small amount of something; an amount that is less than what is needed or wanted
banter:
善意的玩笑，打趣 
friendly remarks and jokes

和某人开玩笑；逗乐 
to joke with somebody
subordinate:
职位较低的；次要的，从属的 
in a position of less power or authority than someone else; less important than someone or something else

把 置于次要地位 
to think of or treat (someone or something) as less important than someone or something else
infraction:
违反 
an act that breaks a rule or law
supposition:
推断 
an idea or theory that you believe is true even though you do not have proof
demean:
贬低，贬损；降低 的身份，使失去尊严 
to cause (someone or something) to seem less important or less worthy of respect

举止；表现 
(archaic, from Old French) to behave, conduct, or comport (oneself)
chagrin:
使懊恼 
to vex or unsettle by disappointing or humiliating

懊悔 
a feeling of being frustrated or annoyed because of failure or disappointment
copious:
大量的；充裕的；丰富的 
in large amounts

abysmal:
深不可测的 
having immense or fathomless extension downward, backward, or inward

糟透的

legacy:

something (such as property or money) that is received from someone who has died
equanimity:
平静，坦然 
calm emotions when dealing with problems or pressure
spontaneous:
自然的，自发的 
done or said in a natural and often sudden way and without a lot of thought or planning
stumble:
绊脚；跌跌撞撞地走；踉跄，步履蹒跚 
to hit your foot on something when you are walking or running so that you fall or almost 
fall, to trip

朗读或说话时结巴，磕磕巴巴 
make a mistake or repeated mistakes in speaking
coercion:
强迫，胁迫 
the use of force to persuade someone to do something that they are unwilling to do
callous:
麻木的，无情的 
not feeling or showing any concern about the problems or suffering of other people
primacy:
首要；至高无上 
the fact of being the most important person or thing
pious:
虔诚的 
deeply religious; devoted to a particular religion 
120
adjacent:
邻近的，毗连的 
next to or adjoining something else
compulsory:
强制性的，强迫的；义务的

41
backdrop:
舞台背景 
a painted cloth that is hung across the back of a stage

背景 
the setting or conditions within which something happens
tilt:
使倾斜 
to move (your head, chin, etc.) up, down, or to one side
extinguish:
熄灭 
to cause (something) to stop burning
topple:
使 摇摇欲坠，倒塌，倒下 
to become unsteady and fall down; to make something do this
begrudge:
舍不得给，吝惜 
to give or allow (something) in a reluctant or unwilling way
beneficiary:
受益者 
a person, organization, etc., that is helped by something; someone or something that

遗嘱的受益人 
a person, organization, etc., that receives money or property when someone dies
avid:
热切的，渴望的 
very eager
endowment:
捐款；捐赠；资助 
money that is given to a school, a college or another institution to provide it with an

天赋；天资；才能

mutation:

lull:
通过哄骗使平息，平静 
to cause (someone) to feel safe and relaxed instead of careful and alert

to cause (someone) to fall asleep or become sleepy 
42
condole:
慰问 
to express sympathetic sorrow
stubborn:
固执的；执拗的；顽固的；倔强的

难以去除或对付的 
difficult to get rid of or deal with
escort:
护送；陪同 
to go with (someone or something) to give protection or guidance

护送者 
a person or group of people who go with someone to give protection or guidance
agile:
头脑灵敏的 
quick, smart, and clever

灵巧的，轻快的 
able to move quickly and easily
unveil:
揭开 
to remove a cover from (something) so that people can see it
unravel:
解开 
to cause the separate threads of something to come apart
ovation:
热烈鼓掌；热烈欢迎 
enthusiastic clapping by an audience as a sign of their approval
mitigate:
缓解 
to make (something) less severe, harmful, or painful
disintegrate:
使分解，使破裂 
to break apart into many small parts or pieces
circumspect:
谨慎小心的 
thinking carefully about possible risks before doing or saying something
chant:
吟诵 
to say (a word or phrase) many times in a rhythmic way usually loudly and with other people

单调有韵律的歌或口号 
a word or phrase that is repeated in a rhythmic way usually loudly and by a group of people
agonizing:
使人极度痛苦的

43
posit:
假定；假设 
to suggest (something, such as an idea or theory) especially in order to start a discussion
lullaby:

a quiet song that is sung to children to help them go to sleep
glisten:
闪光，闪烁
